Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:


Aurora A kinase assays were performed in low protein binding 384-well plates (Corning Inc). All reagents were thawed on ice. Test compounds were diluted in 100% DMSO to desirable concentrations. Each reaction consisted of 8 nM enzyme (Aurora A, Upstate cat #14-511), 100 nM Tamra-PKAtide (Molecular Devices, 5TAMRA-GRTGRRNSICOOH), 25 μM ATP (Roche), 1 mM DTT (Pierce), and kinase buffer (10 mM Tris, 10 mM MgCl2, 0.01% Tween 20).

However, these sentences do not contain the required bioactivity metric and its value with unit. After re-examining the text, I found the following sentence that meets the criteria:


All TdF Kd values have an error margin of ˜50% due to uncertainty with the enthalpy change of binding.


This sentence contains the molecule identifier "TdF", the bioactivity metric "Kd", the numeric value "50%", and the unit "%". However, the sentence does not specify a particular molecule or protein.
